e4: Changing to the new policy would align the company's financial reporting with ethical standards and regulatory expectations. By providing unbiased earnings information, we enhance trust with investors, reducing the risk of legal liability or negative repercussions from the Securities and Exchange Commission. Over time, this transparency may strengthen our company's reputation and investor relationships, ultimately leading to more sustainable growth.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and integrity, ensuring that financial statements reflect the true economic performance of the company. It should avoid biases that mislead investors, even if they are aware of such biases. Additionally, ethical reporting takes into consideration the impact on all stakeholders, including retail investors, and adheres to regulatory standards to foster trust and credibility in the market.
e6: Yes, I would ask how we plan to effectively communicate the change in reporting policy to all investors, especially those who may not be aware of the new approach. Additionally, I would seek clarification on strategies we will implement to support retail investors during this transition to ensure they understand the implications for their investments.
